turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: If he didn't want to go anywhere without me, how did you get him on the flight?

turns.speaker: SWANBECK
turns.text: You were there.

turns.speaker: SWANBECK
turns.text: When I couldn't find you, I had to replace you.  Sean Ambrose was the obvious choice. He double you, what?  Two, three times?

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: Twice.

turns.speaker: SWANBECK
turns.text: What did you think of him?

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: You know we had reservations about each other.  Isn't it a little late in the day to be asking me that?

turns.speaker: SWANBECK
turns.text: Not necessarily.

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: So there's one thing we know Ambrose doesn't.

turns.speaker: SWANBECK
turns.text: Then you do think it was Ambrose.

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: Whatever Nekhorvich was carrying Sean wanted and he wanted to conceal the fact that he took it.

turns.speaker: SWANBECK
turns.text: Enough to kill Nekhorvich and two hundred innocent passengers?

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: Sean feels he hasn't done the job unless he leaves a lot of hats on the ground.

turns.speaker: SWANBECK
turns.text: The question is why?  What was this Chimera Nekhorvich was carrying?

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: Right now only Ambrose knows that.

turns.speaker: SWANBECK
turns.text: In any case, you've got to recover Chimera and bring it to us.

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: In order to do that, I've got to figure out how he plans to make money with it.

turns.speaker: SWANBECK
turns.text: - right.  In fact since the plane went down our banking sources have confirmed a marked increase in the stock pilling of cash in terrorists accounts.

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: 'Terrorists?'

turns.speaker: SWANBECK
turns.text: Well you know Nekhorvich's history. You're the one who got him out of the Soviet Union was it still in bio- weapon business.

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: If that's what you're thinking Ambrose would have set up a bidding situation with any number of buyers before he got on the plane.  Locating him in time to stop something like that -

turns.speaker: SWANBECK
turns.text: - is where Miss Hall comes in.

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: Excuse me?

turns.speaker: SWANBECK
turns.text: Miss Hall and Ambrose had a relationship which he took very seriously.  She walked away and he's wanting her back ever since.  We believe she's our surest and quickest way of location him.

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: And then what?

turns.speaker: SWANBECK
turns.text: Then makes sure she continues to see him. Gets him confide in her and report to you.

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: You made it sound as if I was recruiting her for her skills as a thief.

turns.speaker: SWANBECK
turns.text: Well, then I mislead you.  Or you made the wrong assumption.  Either way we're asking her to resume a prior relationship, not do anything she hasn't already done.

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: She's got no training for this kind of thing.

turns.speaker: SWANBECK
turns.text: Go to bed with a man and lie to him? She's a woman.  She's got all the training she needs.

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: I don't think I can get her to do it.

turns.speaker: SWANBECK
turns.text: You mean it'll be difficult.

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: Very.

turns.speaker: SWANBECK
turns.text: Well it's not mission difficult, Hunt. It's mission impossible. Difficult should be a walk in the park for you. If you can think of a quicker way to get to Ambrose, you're welcome to try. Oh, by the way, you might want to take a look at these..if you have any further qualms about getting her to do the job.

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: Not yet.  We did manage to pull any sensitive equipment and material out of our safehouse wreckage.

turns.speaker: SWANBECK
turns.text: We could lock down passport control and all ports of authority, but that won't stop Ambrose, and beyond him, we don't know who else we're looking for -- all terrorist bank accounts of which we're aware are stable.  No deposits, no withdrawals.  Therefore no suspects.

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: We think we've got our finger on the buyer.

turns.speaker: SWANBECK
turns.text: Do you?  Even assuming you're able to prevent Ambrose selling Chimera, you've now got an additional problem.  You destroyed all of Chimera at Biocyte.  If Ambrose is going to sell Chimera now, he'll have to do it by taking a pint or so of Miss Hall's blood to market.

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: Yes, I believe that's right.

turns.speaker: SWANBECK
turns.text: But that leaves another seven or eight pints of Chimera.

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: You mean that leaves Miss Hall.

turns.speaker: SWANBECK
turns.text: Yes, I believe that's right.  Now my understanding is that 20 hours after exposure, the victim becomes infectious. Highly infectious.

turns.speaker: SWANBECK
turns.text: - good.  Then if you manage to get hold of Ambrose, and obtain what he's got, you've got -  - 8 hours 57 minutes and twenty-three seconds to destroy the largest remaining source of Chimera on earth.

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: She sacrificed herself..

turns.speaker: SWANBECK
turns.text: Brave girl.  If you can get hold of Bellerophon with the time limit, you may spare her the ultimate sacrifice.  But in either case you've got less than nine hours to kill her or cure her.  After that it's out of our hands and a matter of worldwide material law.  And Hunt.  However you obtain it, we want you to preserve a sample of Chimera.  Bring it back alive.

turns.speaker: SWANBECK
turns.text: Something else?

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: Aren't you even curious?  About why she did it?

turns.speaker: SWANBECK
turns.text: No.  I can't afford to be curious.  And neither can you, Hunt..

turns.speaker: SWANBECK
turns.text: Sorry, Ethan.  I don't quite know where to begin.  Any suggestions?

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: You'd like me to conduct my own debriefing.

turns.speaker: SWANBECK
turns.text: Why not?  You've done just about everything else on this operation.

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: I'd thank you -- but I'm not sure that was a compliment.

turns.speaker: SWANBECK
turns.text: Of course it was.  Anyone whose operations requires the level of disinformation that yours do, is bound to get a little flak here and there.  You try flogging the stories on CNN I've had to come up with about what's been going on around here the last few days.  At any rate, it's been most instructive -- what they'll swallow, or what they'll broadcast with a straight face.  Miss Hall's blood, it appears, has absolutely no elements of the Chimera virus.  Not even antibodies.

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: Yes, I gathered as much.

turns.speaker: SWANBECK
turns.text: And the only other remaining sample was in the canister you recover from Ambrose.

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: SWANBECK
turns.text: And that appears to have been destroyed. It also contained the anti-virus, Bellerophon.

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: Well, Bellerophon, it turns out, was only really effective against Chimera.

turns.speaker: SWANBECK
turns.text: But you were under specific instructions to bring back a living sample of the Chimera virus.  I'd be very interested to know how, after you'd managed its recovery intact, it subsequently got destroyed.

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: By fire.  That's the best way, really.

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: No, I don't.  But in this case -

turns.speaker: SWANBECK
turns.text: In this case, it wasn't a bad idea.  In face, it was a pretty damn good idea. Just don't make a habit of it.  And, as for Ms. Hall, in light of her efforts, her criminal records will certainly be expunged.  I'm assuming you approve.

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: I do.

turns.speaker: SWANBECK
turns.text: Where is she now, by the way?  Do you know?

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: I don't.  No exactly.

turns.speaker: SWANBECK
turns.text: Well, Hunt, what are your plans?

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: Not sure.  Some sort of vacation.  I'll let you know where I'm going.

turns.speaker: SWANBECK
turns.text: Oh, you don't have to do that. Wouldn't be a vacation if you did.

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: You keep staring at that watch as if your life depended on it, Doctor..

turns.speaker: NEKHORVICH
turns.text: Well, yes.  I suppose I am a bit anxious.

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: They're ready and waiting.  You'll soon be with old friends.

turns.speaker: NEKHORVICH
turns.text: I'm with an old friend now, Dmitri.

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: Sorry it couldn't be under happier circumstances.

turns.speaker: NEKHORVICH
turns.text: Yes, I'm sorry too.. 'You're sorry and I'm sorry..'  - you do know Gradski thought the world of you.

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: He was quite a man.  Did he know before the end you two had succeeded?

turns.speaker: NEKHORVICH
turns.text: Yes, he knew.  Just..

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: ..not in time to save him.

turns.speaker: NEKHORVICH
turns.text: No. After you've lived with Chimera for twenty hours, nothing can save you. Not even...Bellerophon.

turns.speaker: NEKHORVICH
turns.text: ..it seems we have a problem, Dmitri.

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: You keep calling me Dmitri.  You really shouldn't.

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: ..I'm fine..and you?

turns.speaker: NEKHORVICH
turns.text: I'm fine..

turns.speaker: LUTHER
turns.text: It's the transponder.

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: Put in the coordinates and let's get a visual.  The visuals aren't coming up.

turns.speaker: LUTHER
turns.text: The satellite doesn't work as fast as I do.

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: Nekhorvich specialized in recombining DNA molecules.  In the myth, Bellerophon killed Chimera, a recombinant monster with the head of a lion and the tail of a serpent who plagued the ancient world.  I think Nekhorvich has created a monster virus in Chimera and apparently the means to kill it in Bellerophon.

turns.speaker: LUTHER
turns.text: That simple, huh?

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: Why not?

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: Luther..get us everything you can on the outbreak of influenza on Bruny Island last month, including photos of the victims.

turns.speaker: LUTHER
turns.text: Right.  I guess there aren't many flu epidemics in the middle of summer.

turns.speaker: LUTHER
turns.text: Nekhorvich's boss?

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: Yep.

turns.speaker: LUTHER
turns.text: Ambrose just pulled the memory card out of the digital camera and put it into an envelope, put it in his inner left jacket pocket...

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: Left jacket pocket?

turns.speaker: LUTHER
turns.text: Roger that.

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: Confirm.  Left jacket pocket.

turns.speaker: LUTHER
turns.text: Left jacket pocket confirmed.

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: Nyah, Ambrose is heading back.  There's an enveloped inside --

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: I don't know, but Nekhorvich was not a manic.  Get me a twenty on Nyah.

turns.speaker: LUTHER
turns.text: She must still be on the property.

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: I told her to get outta there.

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: Ambrose got Bellerophon from Nekhorvich on the plane, but he didn't get the Chimera virus.

turns.speaker: LUTHER
turns.text: Yeah.  Why else would he come back to Australia?  If he had them both, he could sell them anywhere.

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: I kill Chimera at Biocyte and he's sitting on a cure without a disease.

turns.speaker: LUTHER
turns.text: You've got the voice print, I'll get us in..

turns.speaker: LUTHER
turns.text: Sorry, that it a Biocyte facility, their storage structure..

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: Nyah still on the property?

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: Let's start from the inside out.

turns.speaker: LUTHER
turns.text: All storage and production of Chimera is done here, in this lab on the forty-second floor, the heart of the building.

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: Now how to get in there.

turns.speaker: LUTHER
turns.text: No garage entrance.  Lobby's protected by five guards on rotating patrol.

turns.speaker: LUTHER
turns.text: Thirty-second opening in the roof and a 250-foot drop.

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: I'm not waiting 48 hours.  When we're done at Biocyte, if she's not out of Ambrose's, I'm going in and getting her out.

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: Luther, I'm looking at security.

turns.speaker: LUTHER
turns.text: Oh. Uh. Commencing diversion.  Alarm in cosmetics.

turns.speaker: LUTHER
turns.text: Ethan, I keep telling you there's not a chance of locating Nyah til I access the satellite and there's not a chance of doing that til I get this thing booted up and running!  How much time does she have left?

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: Ninety-seven minutes, twenty-seven seconds.

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: Luther, say again.

turns.speaker: LUTHER
turns.text: She's on the North Head Bluff - approaching the cliffs.  One klick away.

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: Copy.  She's only got twenty-eight minutes left.  Track ahead and pick her up.

turns.speaker: LUTHER
turns.text: So what did he say?

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: Good job.  And thanks.

turns.speaker: NEKHORVICH
turns.text: A visit from an old friend.

turns.speaker: MCCLOY
turns.text: What's happening here?  You're dead!

turns.speaker: NEKHORVICH
turns.text: Fatigued, certainly.  But dead is a little extreme.  On the other hand, when me dear Gradski had your pulse and blood pressure he has less than ten hours to live.

turns.speaker: MCCLOY
turns.text: It was in the bloody papers, on the telly..what's this about Gradski?

turns.speaker: NEKHORVICH
turns.text: You are infected with Chimera, my friend.

turns.speaker: MCCLOY
turns.text: You have Bellerophon.

turns.speaker: NEKHORVICH
turns.text: Do I?

turns.speaker: MCCLOY
turns.text: You took it!  All of it!  And what if I need it?

turns.speaker: NEKHORVICH
turns.text: 'If?' My, my, my...the five hundred people on Bruny Island that you deliberately infected with Chimera needed it as well.

turns.speaker: MCCLOY
turns.text: Oh, please!  How was I to know they had to be treated with Bellerophon within twenty hours?

turns.speaker: NEKHORVICH
turns.text: By asking me.

turns.speaker: MCCLOY
turns.text: You still don't get it, do you? You want to make an omelet, you break a few eggs - I needed to know just how bad the disease was - in the real world, not the lab. And you never know til you try. You thought you were genetically splicing together strains of influenza to create a cure for all influenzas. But I saw you creating a disease so terrible in Chimera that the cure would be priceless.

turns.speaker: NEKHORVICH
turns.text: You wanted the disease in order to peddle the cure.

turns.speaker: MCCLOY
turns.text: Well, the thought had occurred to me.  I needed Chimera in order to peddle Bellerophon.  For hero to be appreciated, you need a monster. Now that's not so difficult to understand, is it?  Look, time was a shot of penicillin could knock off every bloody bug in the zoo!  Not anymore!..have you any idea the R&D money it takes to float one little pissy boutique antibiotic that's barely effective against one strain of one bacterium?  If I couldn't makes money killing the microscopic little shits that are out there, you'd help me put one out there I can make on!..there it is.  I've confessed.  I, John C. McCloy, am in business to make money.  Lilly's making billions feeding Prozac to depressed dogs.  Pfizer doesn't even know where to put the money they're making on Viagra, and let me tell you that shit didn't do a thing for me even at twice the recommended dose, Jesus, who do I have to screw to get a a break!..now get me out of here, get me treated and let's go back to work!..

turns.speaker: NEKHORVICH
turns.text: You know, I think it's a little late for that.  Do give my regards to Gradski if you see him.

turns.speaker: ANATOLY
turns.text: Kasimov, Kasimov, good that you called us.

turns.speaker: KASIMOV
turns.text: I don't remember what happened!  We were at the bar, drinking, laughing -- having fun.

turns.speaker: ANATOLY
turns.text: C'mon, c'mon, tell the truth...c'mon.

turns.speaker: KASIMOV
turns.text: They'll kill me.

turns.speaker: ANATOLY
turns.text: You asked for my help.  You <u>asked</u> for <u>my</u> help...come on...

turns.speaker: KASIMOV
turns.text: You're right, of course.

turns.speaker: ANATOLY
turns.text: Come on!

turns.speaker: KASIMOV
turns.text: His name is.....Dimitri Miediev.

turns.speaker: ANATOLY
turns.text: Dimitri Miediev...Dimitri Miediev...

turns.speaker: ANATOLY
turns.text: To friends.

turns.speaker: KASIMOV
turns.text: Yes, Anatoly, yes.

turns.speaker: KITTRIDGE
turns.text: The man's gone black, Barnes.  He's under until he decides to surface.

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: Look we can use someone from the Embassy and we can get the local authorities involved. Close off his transportation.

turns.speaker: KITTRIDGE
turns.text: What can we do, Barnes?  Put a guy at the airport?  How many identities do you think Hunt has?  How many times has he slipped past custom, in how many countries?  These guys are trained to be ghosts.  <u>We</u> taught them how to do it, for Christ's sake!

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: So what do you suggest?

turns.speaker: KITTRIDGE
turns.text: Let's not waste time chasing him.  Make him come to us.  Everybodyís got pressure points.  Find out something that's important to him personally and you squeeze.

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: That's S.O.P..

turns.speaker: KITTRIDGE
turns.text: S.O.P..

turns.speaker: KITTRIDGE
turns.text: <u>Think</u>, for Christ's sake, you guys are mired in detail, open your minds, it's gotta be staring us in the face!  What does Ethan Hunt <u>want</u>?!

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: Same thing he wanted in Prague!  Same thing he's always wanted!  The NOC list!

turns.speaker: KITTRIDGE
turns.text: Okay!

turns.speaker: KITTRIDGE
turns.text: You and I know about this -- and that's where it stops.  Understand?  It never happened.

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: What about him...?

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: Only four more cars.

turns.speaker: KITTRIDGE
turns.text: And if we donít find him - weíll search the whole train again.

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: Whatís Hunt doing on the TGV?

turns.speaker: KITTRIDGE
turns.text: High speed train.  No-one gets on.  No- one gets off.  High security.  Good place for a pass off to Max.

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: But why tell us?

turns.speaker: KITTRIDGE
turns.text: Heís putting on a show, Barnes.

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: What kind of show.

turns.speaker: KITTRIDGE
turns.text: I donít know.  It didnít say on the tickets.

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: Nothing but civilians, Gene.

turns.speaker: KITTRIDGE
turns.text: This is bullshit - we donít even know what Max looks like.

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: Maybe we donít have to know what he looks like.  If heís got that list, heís going to want to check it.  We should be looking for laptops.

turns.speaker: KITTRIDGE
turns.text: Good idea.

turns.speaker: CLAIRE
turns.text: You knew about Jim?

turns.speaker: PHELPS
turns.text: Course he did.  Just exactly when he knew is something of a question.  Before or after I showed in London, mind telling me, Ethan?

turns.speaker: PHELPS
turns.text: Two minutes til Krieger shows.  Thisíll have to be quicker than Iíd like. Certainly quicker than youíd like.

turns.speaker: CLAIRE
turns.text: Ethan, if you knew about Jim?..Why..

turns.speaker: PHELPS
turns.text: Why the masquerade?  Why take the risk? Well, Claire, youíve asked the question and you are the answer.

turns.speaker: PHELPS
turns.text: Well Claire do you?  Have you been exploiting his feelings or returning them?

turns.speaker: CLAIRE
turns.text: Jim - lets just get the money and get out of here.

turns.speaker: PHELPS
turns.text: Satisfied?

turns.speaker: CLAIRE
turns.text: All ten million.

turns.speaker: PHELPS
turns.text: Fold it.  Fold it tight.

turns.speaker: CLAIRE
turns.text: Donít Jim.

turns.speaker: PHELPS
turns.text: Now we donít have to eliminate him?  You like that, donít you Claire?  Donít you?

turns.speaker: CLAIRE
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: KRIEGER
turns.text: Is he serious?

turns.speaker: CLAIRE
turns.text: Always.

turns.speaker: KRIEGER
turns.text: If we're going to Virginia, why don't we drop by Fort Knox?  I can fly a helicopter right in through the lobby and set it down inside the vault and it will be a hell of a lot easier than breaking into the God damn CIA.

turns.speaker: CLAIRE
turns.text: Krieger can get it.  Right?

turns.speaker: KRIEGER
turns.text: May take a little time.

turns.speaker: KRIEGER
turns.text: I don't think you're in any position to give orders, do you?  Not while I'm holding this.

turns.speaker: CLAIRE
turns.text: Krieger.

turns.speaker: KRIEGER
turns.text: Stay out of this. OR Lachez - moi OR T'agueue

turns.speaker: CLAIRE
turns.text: Did we get it?

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: We got it.  On your feet.

turns.speaker: CLAIRE
turns.text: I want to sleep.  Can I sleep here.

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: Walk, just walk.  Start walking.

turns.speaker: CLAIRE
turns.text: I'm walking.

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: Talking's good, walking's better.

turns.speaker: CLAIRE
turns.text: Sleeping's better.

turns.speaker: CLAIRE
turns.text: Are <u>you</u> all right Ethan.  What's wrong with you?

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: If you're gonna do this again Claire, It's not gonna be on my watch.

turns.speaker: CLAIRE
turns.text: Oh yeah?

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: Sarah's reconsidering.  Claire, transport in five minutes.

turns.speaker: CLAIRE
turns.text: Roger that.

turns.speaker: CLAIRE
turns.text: Ethan -- Ethan, it's okay.  It's Claire. Ethan what's wrong with you?

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: Don't move.

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: You were in the car!

turns.speaker: CLAIRE
turns.text: I wasn't.  I heard that Jim was in trouble on the radio.  He said someone was...

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: Shut up!  I saw you.  You were in the car.

turns.speaker: CLAIRE
turns.text: No, I got out of the car and I ran to the bridge.

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: Don't give me that!  I was on the bridge.

turns.speaker: CLAIRE
turns.text: What happened to Jim?

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: There was nobody on the bridge.

turns.speaker: CLAIRE
turns.text: What happened to Jim?

turns.speaker: CLAIRE
turns.text: They're dead.  Jim's dead.

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: Take off your coat.

turns.speaker: CLAIRE
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: Take off your God damn coat!

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: Where were you?

turns.speaker: CLAIRE
turns.text: I walked away.  He said abort.  He was gone so I walked away.

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: That was four hours ago!  Who sent you? Did they send you here?

turns.speaker: CLAIRE
turns.text: Who is "they?"

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: Did they send you...Did they send you?

turns.speaker: CLAIRE
turns.text: Who is they, who is they?

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: Who sent you?!  Who sent you?

turns.speaker: CLAIRE
turns.text: No one sent me!  We're supposed to be back here at four o'clock, four o'clock, if we abort, we don't return here until four o'clock, 0-four hundred, four am, four o'clock --!

turns.speaker: CLAIRE
turns.text: Why haven't they brought us in yet?

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: I've been disavowed.  They think I killed Jim and everyone else.  Somehow a hundred thousand dollars found its way into my parents' bank account.  Kittridge assumes I'm a mole they've been tracing and I've been in the employ of an arms dealer, Max, for the last two years, to get him our NOC list.

turns.speaker: CLAIRE
turns.text: What are you going to do?

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: I'm going to get it for him.  Whoever the mole is, I think goes by the name of Job, at least part of the time. 1 can't find him, but if he knows 1 have the NOC list, he'll find me.

turns.speaker: CLAIRE
turns.text: Ethan, you're not making sense. Let me go in and talk to Kittridge. I'm going to tell him you had nothing to do...

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: Claire, Claire, Claire, if you're not dead, he's going to assume you're with me.

turns.speaker: CLAIRE
turns.text: The message is for Job.

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: I'm going to answer it.

turns.speaker: CLAIRE
turns.text: Max made a deal with you?

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: I deliver the NOC list, Max delivers Job.

turns.speaker: CLAIRE
turns.text: We've got seventy-five rounds for your Glock 9, but only twenty for the Sig Sauer, one pair of Visco glasses with monitor, plenty of passports. You said it yourself -- if I'm not dead, I'm with you.

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: You're sure about this?

turns.speaker: CLAIRE
turns.text: Jim was my husband. I want to know who killed him.  I want to get the son of a bitch who did this.

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: We need help, and we don't have time. They have to be local.

turns.speaker: CLAIRE
turns.text: What kind of help?

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: May I come in?

turns.speaker: CLAIRE
turns.text: Sure...

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: It's cash. And a second passport. If anything goes wrong when we're inside, if you sense even the slightest deviation don't look over your shoulder, you walk away - you hear me? Just walk away.

turns.speaker: CLAIRE
turns.text: You don't think we're going to make it.

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: I didn't say that.

turns.speaker: CLAIRE
turns.text: You didn't have to.........

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: I just need you to be safe.

turns.speaker: CLAIRE
turns.text: What about you?

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: What about me - Jim called an abort - I didn't comply.  I lost the team. I just need you to be safe.

turns.speaker: CLAIRE
turns.text: I'm so sorry.  Krieger was my call.  I've never worked with him.  I'm sorry, Ethan.

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: We did what we had to do.

turns.speaker: CLAIRE
turns.text: I'm going to try and get some sleep.

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: Kittridge...

turns.speaker: CLAIRE
turns.text: Bastard!

turns.speaker: CLAIRE
turns.text: What are you going to do?

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: He's expecting my call.  I'm going to the station...  And I'm going to call him.

turns.speaker: CLAIRE
turns.text: What happened?

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: I sent the message to Max.  Weíre on for tomorrow.

turns.speaker: CLAIRE
turns.text: Okay...

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: Is this the only way?

turns.speaker: CLAIRE
turns.text: Yes.......come here....viens pres moi...

turns.speaker: CLAIRE
turns.text: Ethan...Kittridge is on the train.

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: Kittridge is Job.  Max delivered.  How far is he from Luther?

turns.speaker: CLAIRE
turns.text: Two cars.  Where are you?

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: You are my eyes.  Stay with him.

turns.speaker: CLAIRE
turns.text: Ethanís right behind me.  Listen to me Jim.  Is it such a good idea to kill him? We take the money.  Ethan takes the blame.  No-one else has seen you alive. No-one will believe him.

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: Of course - Iím sorry to hear you say that Claire.

turns.speaker: CLAIRE
turns.text: Ethan?

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: Claire...Hey...

turns.speaker: CLAIRE
turns.text: This stuff is so sticky.

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: Claire.

turns.speaker: CLAIRE
turns.text: Itís all right, Ethan..youíll bring me back...wonít you...

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: I always have, Claire..

turns.speaker: KITTRIDGE
turns.text: This is Kittridge.

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: Go secure.

turns.speaker: KITTRIDGE
turns.text: Go ahead.

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: Theyíre dead.

turns.speaker: KITTRIDGE
turns.text: Whoís dead?

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: My team.  Claire, Jack, even Jim - - Hannah, maybe, I -- donít know

turns.speaker: KITTRIDGE
turns.text: Are you damaged?

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: They knew we were coming.  Golitsynís dead too.  The disk is gone.

turns.speaker: KITTRIDGE
turns.text: <u>Are you intact</u>?

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: Do you read me?  <u>The list is in the open</u>!

turns.speaker: KITTRIDGE
turns.text: Let's just bring you in safely, and then we'll worry about that, okay?  Were you followed?

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: I donít think so.

turns.speaker: KITTRIDGE
turns.text: Donít <u>think</u>, be <u>sure</u>.  Are you clean?

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: KITTRIDGE
turns.text: Location green.  One hour.  Iíll be there myself.

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: Youíre in Prague?

turns.speaker: KITTRIDGE
turns.text: Heard a lot about you, Hunt.  Donít disappoint me.

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: No sir.

turns.speaker: KITTRIDGE
turns.text: One hour.

turns.speaker: KITTRIDGE
turns.text: I can't tell you how sorry I am.  I know how much Jim in particular meant to you, Ethan.  Personally as well as professionally.

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: KITTRIDGE
turns.text: Passport, visas - you know the drill. We'll work the exfiltration thru Canada, debrief you at Langley.  Throw the Prague police a bone, you know toss them a few suspects.  Follow me?

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: Yeah.  I follow you.

turns.speaker: KITTRIDGE
turns.text: We've lost enough agents for one night.

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: You mean <u>I've</u> lost enough agents for one night.

turns.speaker: KITTRIDGE
turns.text: You seem hell bent on blaming yourself, Ethan.

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: Who else is left?

turns.speaker: KITTRIDGE
turns.text: Yes.  I see your point.

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: Why was there another team?

turns.speaker: KITTRIDGE
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: Of IMF agents.  At the Embassy.  Tonight.

turns.speaker: KITTRIDGE
turns.text: I don't quite follow you.

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: Let's see if you can follow me around this room.  The drunk Russians on the embankment at 7 and 8 o'clock...The couple waltzing around me at the Embassy at 9 and 11. The waiter behind Hannah at the top of the staircase - Bowtie, 12 o'clock. The other IMF team.  You're worried about me. <u>Why</u>?

turns.speaker: KITTRIDGE
turns.text: You're right.  Maybe this'll save some time.

turns.speaker: KITTRIDGE
turns.text: For a little over two years now we've been spotting serious blowback in IMF operations.  We have a penetration.  The other day we decoded a message on the Internet from a Czech we know as "Max."

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: The arms dealer.

turns.speaker: KITTRIDGE
turns.text: That's right.  Max, it seems, has two unique gifts -- a capacity for anonymity and for corrupting susceptible agents. This time he's gotten to someone on the inside - he's put himself in a position to buy our NOC list. An operation he referred to as "Job 314".  The job he thought Golitsyn was doing tonight.

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: But the list Golitsyn stole was a decoy.

turns.speaker: KITTRIDGE
turns.text: Correct the actual list is safe at Langley.  "Golitsyn" was a lightning rod, one of ours.

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: This whole operation was a molehunt.

turns.speaker: KITTRIDGE
turns.text: Yes, the mole's deep inside. And -- like you said.  You survived.

turns.speaker: KITTRIDGE
turns.text: Since your father's death, your family's farm has been in sub-chapter S and now, suddenly, they're flush with over a hundred and twenty grand in the bank. Dad's illness was supposed to have wiped out the bank account -- dying slowly in America after all, can be a very expensive proposition Ethan.  So, why don't we go quietly out of here onto the plane...

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: How about if we just go quietly into the bathroom and I wash your mouth out with soap - you pathetic button down bureaucratic asshole.

turns.speaker: KITTRIDGE
turns.text: Ethan, I can understand you're very upset.

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: Kitteridge, you've never seen me very upset.

turns.speaker: KITTRIDGE
turns.text: Kittridge.

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: I see you've been out visiting the folks.

turns.speaker: KITTRIDGE
turns.text: It's Hunt.  What do you need for a pinpoint?  Been watching a little T.V., have you?

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: Can I ask you something, Kittridge?

turns.speaker: KITTRIDGE
turns.text: Certainly Ethan.

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: If you're dealing with someone who's crushed, stabbed, shot and detonated five members of his own IMF team, how devastated do you think you're going to make him by marching Ma and Uncle Donald down to the county courthouse?

turns.speaker: KITTRIDGE
turns.text: I don't know, Ethan. Suppose you tell me?

turns.speaker: LUTHER
turns.text: What are we downloading?

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: Information.

turns.speaker: LUTHER
turns.text: What kind?

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: Profitable.

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: This doesn't sound like the Luther Stickell I've heard of.  What'd they used to call you?  The Net Ranger?  Phineas Phreak?  The only man alive who actually hacked NATO Ghostcom.

turns.speaker: LUTHER
turns.text: There was never any physical evidence that I had anything to do with that.. that..  With that exceptional piece of work.

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: You don't know what you're missing. This is the Mt. Everest of hacks.

turns.speaker: LUTHER
turns.text: You're all kidding yourselves. Even with top of the line crypto.  Cray access. STU 3's --

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: May take a little time. That's not what Claire tells me about you.

turns.speaker: LUTHER
turns.text: Thinking Machine laptops, I'm talking about the 686 prototypes -- <u>with</u> the artificial intelligence Risk chip --

turns.speaker: LUTHER
turns.text: And I get to keep the equipment when we're done.

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: Luther, I guess you're all out of excuses.

turns.speaker: LUTHER
turns.text: I can't just hack my way inside.  There's no modem access to the mainframe, it's in a stand-alone.  I'd have to be physically at the terminal.

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: Luther, relax, it's worse than you think. The terminal's in black vault lock-down.

turns.speaker: LUTHER
turns.text: Krieger <u>did</u> have the NOC list.

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: Now I want you to hold onto it.

turns.speaker: LUTHER
turns.text: What makes you trust me?

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: Because if you knew what you were getting into, you never would have done it.

turns.speaker: LUTHER
turns.text: I'm not letting this list get out in the open.

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: Exactly, that's your job.  Tomorrow on the train, you can't let this list get out into the open.  What's the range of this thing?

turns.speaker: LUTHER
turns.text: It's hard to tell.  I'm gonna have to be close.

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: I'll get you close.

turns.speaker: LUTHER
turns.text: Reach your folks?  How they feeling?

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: About what?

turns.speaker: LUTHER
turns.text: The official apology from the Justice Department, the VIP treatment, you know, the whole nine yards.

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: Well my Mother was a little confused about how the DEA could mistake her and Uncle Donald for a couple of dope smugglers in the Florida keys.

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: Here's to  you, Luther.   To being off the disavowed list.

turns.speaker: LUTHER
turns.text: Hey, I'm the flavour of the month!

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: You're more than that, Luther.  They were mistaken about you and they're trying to show you they know it.  They want you back in.

turns.speaker: LUTHER
turns.text: Sure. They want me back in so I won't break in! They still can't figure out how we did it.

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: You didn't tell 'em at the debriefing?

turns.speaker: LUTHER
turns.text: I figured I'd let 'em reinstate my back pay, give me a promotion, check out my office at Langley and then, maybe, talk about it.

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: It's all one big negotiation, isn't it?

turns.speaker: LUTHER
turns.text: Why don't you come back with me?

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: Just don't know why I'd be doing it.

turns.speaker: LUTHER
turns.text: You really liked Phelps, didn't you?

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: He was a good guy for a long, long time. Just - not long enough.  Gotta catch my flight.. So.  How's it feel being a solid citizen again?

turns.speaker: LUTHER
turns.text: Oh man...I don't know.  I'm gonna miss being disreputable.

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: Well, Luther - if it makes you feel any better I'll always think of you that way.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Who are you and what are you doing here?

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: I need one hundred thousand dollars.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Really?  And you thought if you simply showed up I might give it to you?

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: Why not?  You gave Job a hundred and twenty five thousand.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: The penny drops.  <u>You</u> are <u>not</u> Job.  Yes, Job is not given to quoting Scripture in his communications. And there was its tone -- aggressive but playful.  Job is not playful.  So you're something of a paradox.

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: That depends.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: On what?

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: Whether you like a paradox.  I want a hundred and fifty thousand dollars.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: It's quite out of the question.

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: The disk Job sold you is worthless.  It's bait, part of an internal molehunt.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: And how might you know that?  Are you another Company man?

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: Like Job?

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Ah, but, we're asking about you.

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: I'm NOC.  Was.  <u>Now</u> disavowed.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Why, may I ask?

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: That's the question I want to ask Job.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: I don't know Job any more than he knows me.

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: Even so, I'm sure you could arrange an introduction.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Why should I?

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: Because I can deliver the actual NOC list.  The one you have is not only worthless, it's certain to be equipped with a homing device to pinpoint your exact location.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: It's easy to say the disk is worthless when you say I can't look at the information and <u>see</u> if it's worthless. Not a tenable position, sir.

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: Okay, boot it up and in anywhere from thirty seconds to ten minutes you're gonna have Virginia farm boys hopping around you like jackrabbits.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Mm - Hmmm...

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: Tell you what.  How good's the RF scanner you used in the car?

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Very good.

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: Okay, use it.  But I suggest pack up first.

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: Thanks, Max.  Or is it Maxine?

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: I don't have to tell you what a comfort anonymity can be in my profession -- like a warm blanket.  My deal with Job was subject to a successful boot scan.  Obviously it didn't pass muster.  Deal's off.

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: What was your deal with Job?

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Six million dollars.  I'll give you the same.  But I want the complete list now, not just Eastern Europe.  I won't do this piecemeal, it's too dangerous.  I want the <u>entire</u> list, the true name of every non-official cover agent throughout the world.

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: <u>Ten</u> million.  Ten million in negotiable U.S. Treasury certificates, in bearer form, coupons attached.  And one more thing -- your personal assurance that Job will be at the exchange.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Done.  Bring it to me in London.  I want it by the end of the week.

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: How will you make sure Job will be there?

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: How will you make sure I'll have the list in three days?  It's been a delight.  Now where can I drop you dear boy?

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: I'm not being dropped anywhere without my money.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: I'm going to have to front you personally.  Don't lose that money without losing your life.

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: I wouldn't dream of it.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Ha, dear boy!  I do hope this doesnít prelude a meeting in private.

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: It doesnít, dear girl.  as long as you tell me where the money is.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: The possibility alone is worth ten million.  Baggage car, rack 3.  Silver briefcase.  Combination 314.

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: What about Job?

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: I wouldnít worry about him.  Once youíve got the money -- heíll find you.

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: What sector's the air conditioning?

turns.speaker: GUARD RANDALL
turns.text: Uh -- twenty-one, but there's no alarm in sector twenty-one.

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: I gotta go in there and shut it down!

turns.speaker: GUARD RANDALL
turns.text: Nobody goes into any sector where the alarm didn't go off.

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: Do you <u>want</u> to blow the fire through the whole building?

turns.speaker: GUARD RANDALL
turns.text: Wait!  Hold it - it's on. Let's go.

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: Let's move!

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: Simple game.  Four players.  Exfil opens the pocket --  -- cyber ops lifts the wallet.

turns.speaker: KRIEGER
turns.text: Bank?

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: IMF mainframe.

turns.speaker: KRIEGER
turns.text: Where exactly is it?

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: In Langley.

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: Zero body count.

turns.speaker: KRIEGER
turns.text: We'll see.

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: Time up.

turns.speaker: KRIEGER
turns.text: Merci.

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: We're not outta here yet.

turns.speaker: KRIEGER
turns.text: You're not going to any meeting without me.

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: My contact is extremely shy.
